titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: John Taylor Arms (1887-1953) was an architect and printmaker. He studied architecture at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, graduating in 1914. His artwork focused on buildings and cityscapes, both in New York and in Europe. He was a member of many printmaking societies, serving as president of the American Society of Graphic Artists.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of sketchbooks, notebooks and scrapbooks of John Taylor Arms. Materials include: sketchbooks from European travels, many with architectural details; notebooks on etching, lithography and printing mediums, pigments and varnishes; appointment books and consignment records; scrapbooks of clippings related to Society of American Etchers exhibits; and one scrapbook on Dorothy Noyes Arms. The collection also has meeting minutes and photographs of posters for Artists for Victory and minutes of meetings of the Art Association Representatives for a New York World's Fair exhibit.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution: Microfilm copies of these records as well as microfilm of additional John Taylor Arms papers.
